title: Intramolecular nucleophilic catalysis and the exceptional reactivity of N-benzyloxycarbonyl alpha-aminophosphonochloridates.
abstract: The chloridate BnOCONHCH2P(O)(OMe)Cl is 103–104 times more reactive than ClCH2P(O)(OMe)Cl in substitution with PriOH; the α,α-dimethyl analogue is no less reactive and the N-methyl derivative is more reactive; nucleophilic participation (catalysis) by the carbamate group is implicated

Intramolecular nucleophilic catalysis and the exceptional reactivity of N-benzyloxycarbonyl alpha-aminophosphonochloridates.</dc:title><dc:creator>
Cullis, P. M.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
Harger, M. J. P.</dc:creator><dc:description>
The chloridate BnOCONHCH2P(O)(OMe)Cl is 103–104 times more reactive than ClCH2P(O)(OMe)Cl in substitution with PriOH; the α,α-dimethyl analogue is no less reactive and the N-methyl derivative is more reactive; nucleophilic participation (catalysis) by the carbamate group is implicated.</dc:description><dc:date>
